ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
ygData.msgSnippet: i agreed with Lyrnia too.  the argument is not to have higher hit points, damage output, defensive skills.  that is what makes a warrior/tank.  the argument
ygData.messageBody:
i agreed with Lyrnia too. the argument is not to have higher hit points,
damage output, defensive skills. that is what makes a warrior/tank. the
argument was for AC. and i agreed the singing steel AC was fine, but others
thought it could be higher. this is a very valid point. the clerics i know
all have AC a lot higher than me, and that is for a good reason. like
clerics, we get our asses beat on a lot playing our songs. not as much as
we used to, and that is another huge point, and also why i think the AC is
fine on singing steel, i mean it's better than imbrued. they vastly reduced
the taunt factor of our songs, and thus made the proc on a level 51+ weapon
and level 53 song much less useful. and neither the symphonic harmony proc
nor the song of dawn can be reliably tested, so who is to say they work at
all? also i don't think summon drink and summon drink are useful at levels
51+. i didn't get 53 levels to give my group food and water. invisibility
for a warrior... incredibly useful!

Shada Powa, L53 Wood Elf Minstrel
Tyria Sarkin, L50 High Elf Wizard
<Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server


> Guys, we're a support class not warriors remember?
>
> [51 Minstrel] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work
